main event: On 5th September 1949, an unconventional aircraft of approximately 36 feet in diameter was sighted in Lebec, California by a witness flying at approximately 7,000 feet above sea level. The aircraft was described as oval-shaped, metallic, and appeared to be rising rapidly before veering off in a southerly direction, with no signs of exhaust or sound.
interesting points: The witness observed an unconventional aircraft with no visible means of propulsion or control, making a rapid ascent before changing direction and disappearing from sight
Aerial photographs taken of the area revealed unidentifiable objects on the ground, further adding to the mysterious nature of the sighting
The witness was considered truthful and reliable, based on agency checks and character evaluations
No commercial or civilian aircraft were reported in the area at the time of the sighting, ruling out conventional aircraft as an explanation
Weather reports and aircraft departure records did not provide evidence of any known aircraft or weather anomalies that could explain the sighting
sighted object: unconventional aircraft of approximately 36 feet in diameter
witnesses: SGT [Redacted] of 3538th Maintenance Squadron, Mather AFB, California
